text: I got some good news about the future of the Oregon Humane Society, and thought fellow animal lovers would like to hear the scoop on the newest plans.
We’ve had more large scale animal rescues in recent years, which involves challenging logistics when dealing with dozens of animals in crisis.
They’re working to open up a dedicated rescue center for large scale animal rescues. They’ll also set up an environment to rehab frightened animals to adapt to good home life.
And a HUGE reason for animal surrenders has been the cost of vet care. They’re working to open a community teaching hospital with affordable full service vet care.

It’s a multi year plan, but having watched them in my 20 years of volunteering, starting with the opening of the beautiful building they’re in now, the new teaching hospital, and training programs, I have a lot of faith in their ability to execute. So it’s good news for future animal rescues.
:clap: this is amazing news, thx for sharing <@U0HP6TFNX>. and go OHS!
